citation.article-title: Oceaniserpentilla haliotis gen. nov., sp. nov., a marine bacterium isolated from haemolymph serum of blacklip abalone.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Oceaniserpentilla (O.ce.a.ni.ser.pen.til′la. L. masc. n. oceanus the ocean; L. fem. n. serpens -tis a snake; N.L. fem. n. serpentilla a small snake; N.L. fem. n. Oceaniserpentilla small snake of the ocean, indicating shape and origin).
Gram-negative, motile, obligately aerobic, vibrioid to spiral, non-spore-forming cells.
Oxidase activity is present, whereas catalase activity is absent.
A member of the family Oceanospirillaceae.
The type species is Oceaniserpentilla haliotis.
